quest.guide.world.foodhealth.title: More Food, More Health
quest.guide.world.foodhealth.subtitle: Stress eating.
quest.guide.world.foodhealth.description: The more types of food you consume, the more §bbonus hearts§r you get.
This guidebook serves as a tracker for the foods you have eaten.
§cWARNING:§r It is recommended you try to focus on increasing your max HP only once you're confident you can survive, as these bonuses can only be claimed once!
quest.guide.parkour.title: Beginner's Guide to Parkour
quest.guide.parkour.subtitle: This book... it's written in parkour...
quest.guide.parkour.description_1: Many of the important skills are listed in the images below. For a more comprehensive guide, make sure to read through the §bParcool§r guidebook!
quest.guide.parkour.description_2: Learning to use parkour properly will give you an advantage when navigating in the city - consider building a parkour course to familiarize yourself.
quest.guide.parkour.description_3: If you want to §cdisable§r certain Parcool actions, press §6[Alt+P]§r to bring up the config menu.
quest.guide.parkour.crawl: You can crawl by holding §bC§r; it allows you to go through 1-block-height spots.
quest.guide.parkour.ziplinehook.title: Ziplines
quest.guide.parkour.ziplinehook.subtitle: Hang in there...
quest.guide.parkour.ziplinehook.descript: Parcool introudces §bziplines§r, which allow you to travel between buildings that are connected by zipline hooks.
To begin, craft a wooden or iron zipline hook.
quest.guide.parkour.ziplinerope.title: Zipline Rope
quest.guide.parkour.ziplinerope.subtitle: Bridging the Gap
quest.guide.parkour.ziplinerope.descript: Once your hooks are installed, you can connect them with zipline rope. §6[Shift-Right Click]§r to adjust the tension on the rope.
You can grab onto zipline ropes by jumping and holding right click.
quest.guide.parkour.dodge: You can dodge by tapping CTRL while moving!
quest.guide.parkour.wall_slide: You can hold right click when falling next to a wall to go down slowly!
quest.guide.parkour.cling: You can hold right click near a block border to cling on the wall.
quest.guide.parkour.cat_leap: Tap shift while running to cat leap!
quest.guide.parkour.slide: Hold C while running to slide.
quest.guide.parkour.breakfall: Press R before landing for minimal damage!
quest.guide.survival.subtitle: AKA: How to not die instantly.
quest.guide.survival.thirst.title: Dealing With Thirst
quest.guide.survival.thirst.subtitle: Be like water.
quest.guide.survival.thirst.description_: Bottled water is §cdirty§r by default, and must be purified by boiling in order to safely be drunk.
quest.guide.survival.furnace.title: Let Him Cook - I
quest.guide.survival.furnace.subtitle: The normal way.
quest.guide.survival.furnace.description: Boil water in a §bfurnace§r to purify it, ensuring it is safe for consumption.
quest.guide.survival.cooking_pot.title: Let Him Cook - II
quest.guide.survival.cooking_pot.desc_1: Boil a water bucket in a §bcooking pot§r to get 16 purified water, which you can take out with a glass bottle. Remember to retrieve your bucket!
quest.guide.survival.sink.title: Water on Demand
quest.guide.survival.sink.subtitle: Let that Sink In
quest.guide.survival.sink.description_1: Some sinks can provide an endless supply of water, but keep in mind it still needs to be boiled!
quest.guide.survival.water.title: Purified Water
quest.guide.survival.water.subtitle: Crystal clear.
quest.guide.survival.water.description_1: Once purified, water can be safely consumed.
quest.guide.survival.fiber.title: Fiber on Demand
quest.guide.survival.fiber.subtitle: Hemp 101
quest.guide.survival.fiber.description_1: Collect §bhemp seeds§r from grass and plant them to start growing hemp plants. It's recommended you keep a healthy amount of these, as crafting string uses a lot of fibre.
quest.guide.survival.string.title: String
quest.guide.survival.string.description_: Craft hemp into string, or loot it from cities.
quest.guide.survival.wool.title: Wool
quest.guide.survival.wool.description_1: Craft string into wool. Or start a sheep farm.
quest.guide.survival.herbs.title: Healing Herbs
quest.guide.survival.herbs.subtitle: It's the green, it's the green, it's the green you need...
quest.guide.survival.herbs.description_1: Healing herbs are essential for crafting higher tier recovery items. Unfortunately, they can only be looted from §bmedical buildings§r.
quest.guide.survival.tonic.title: Tonic
quest.guide.survival.plaster.title: I need healing.
quest.guide.survival.plaster.subtitle: For the small ouchies.
quest.guide.survival.plaster.description: Plasters don't heal much, but they are cheap to craft.
quest.guide.survival.bandages.title: I need healing!
quest.guide.survival.bandages.subtitle: For larger wounds.
quest.guide.survival.bandages.descriptio: While better than bandages, consider saving up to craft these into §bmedkits§r instead, which are much more powerful.
quest.guide.survival.medkit.title: I NEED HEALING!!
quest.guide.survival.medkit.subtitle: ...I guess we're sewing your arm back on.
quest.guide.survival.medkit.description_: The best tier of medical treatment. You could craft these... but perhaps it would be better to try and find them in §bhospitals§r.
quest.guide.survival.headache.title: Headache
quest.guide.survival.headache.subtitle: Caused by damage to your head.
quest.guide.survival.vulnerability.title: Vulnerability
quest.guide.survival.vulnerability.subti: Caused by damage to your torso.
quest.guide.survival.vulnerability.descr: All damage taken from any source except falling is §cincreased§r by 20%% per level.
quest.guide.survival.mining_fatigue.subt: Caused by damage to your arms.
quest.guide.survival.weakness.title: Weakness
quest.guide.survival.weakness.subtitle: Caused by damage to your arms.
quest.guide.survival.weakness.descriptio: §cWeakens§r your attack damage, possibly reducing it to 0 if it's already low enough.
quest.guide.survival.hard_falling.title: Hard Falling
quest.guide.survival.hard_falling.subtit: Caused by damage to your legs.
quest.guide.survival.hard_falling.descri: Fall damage is §cincreased§r by 20%% per level.
quest.guide.survival.slowness.title: Slowness
quest.guide.survival.slowness.subtitle: Caused by damage to your feet.
quest.guide.survival.life.title: LIFE
quest.guide.survival.life.subtitle: Welcome to the world.
quest.guide.survival.life.description_1: Managing your health is essential to survival. This modpack has §6body part damage§r, which means limbs can be damaged, causing debuffs.
quest.guide.survival.life.description_2: You can check the status of your limbs at any time by pressing §6[H]§r to bring up the health tab.
quest.guide.survival.life.description_3: A list of debuffs caused by damage to each limb is provided below.
quest.guide.survival.death.title: DEATH
quest.guide.survival.death.subtitle: Ask not for whom the bell tolls...
quest.guide.survival.death.description_1: Death means §cpermanently§r losing 1 heart gained from Crystal Hearts, so try avoiding it as much as possible!
quest.guide.survival.death.description_2: The minimum amount of hearts you can have is §610§r. If you are still learning, it may be wise to wait till you are better prepared before trying to gain extra hearts.
quest.guide.survival.death.description_3: §6Vanilla hearts are seperate from body part damage.§r You can lose all your limbs and you will not die besides suffering the debuffs, but losing all your vanilla hearts will kill you!
quest.guide.survival.death.description_4: Keeping your vanilla hearts at full health will regenerate your limbs over time, but slowly. Regeneration potions will also heal your limbs over time as well.
quest.guide.survival.hearts.title: Crystal Hearts
quest.guide.survival.hearts.subtitle: Me and my broken heart...
quest.guide.survival.hearts.description_: Crystal Hearts can be looted from §bhospital buildings§r. Each one increases your max health by §bone heart§r, up to a total of 10 hearts.
§cWARNING:§r It is recommended you try to focus on increasing your max HP only once you're confident you can survive, as these items cannot be crafted!
quest.guide.temperature.subtitle: Ahhhh, that's hot.
quest.guide.temperature.boiler.title: Warm Me Up
quest.guide.temperature.boiler.subtitle: Getting hot in here...
quest.guide.temperature.boiler.descripti: Boilers provide heat in a radius if powered by redstone and provided with §bburnable materials§r like coal.
quest.guide.temperature.icebox.title: Cool Me Down
quest.guide.temperature.icebox.subtitle: Chill out, bro...
quest.guide.temperature.icebox.descripti: Iceboxes provide chill in an area if  powered by redstone and provided with §bfrozen items§r like ice.
quest.guide.temperature.thermometer.desc: A thermometer can accurately measure the present temperature of the environment.
Craft or find one from §bresidential houses§r.
quest.guide.temperature.seasons.title: Seasons
quest.guide.temperature.seasons.subtitle: Let it snow
quest.guide.temperature.seasons.descript: The ambient §btemperature§r of a region changes depending on the §rseason§r, with §6summer§r and §bwinter§r being the §6hottest§r and §bcoldest§r respectively.
Putting a §bcalender§r in an §bitem frame§r will allow you to keep track of the §bcurrent season§r, as well as how many §6days§r are left till the §bnext season§r.
Craft or find one from §bresidential houses§r.
quest.guide.temperature.insulation.title: Insulating Armor
quest.guide.temperature.insulation.descr: A grace period of §b5 minutes§r is given on every respawn during which you are immune to changes in temperature.
However, venturing further into the city will require insulating your armor, and you will quickly freeze or overheat if unprepared.
Use a §bsewing table§r to insulate your armor with various materials.
quest.guide.temperature.cold_1.title: Beating the Heat - I
quest.guide.temperature.cold_1.descripti: Coat your armor to increase §6heat resistance§r by 3 points.
quest.guide.temperature.cold_2.title: Beating the Heat - II
quest.guide.temperature.cold_2.descripti: Coat your armor to increase §6heat resistance§r by 5 points.
quest.guide.temperature.cold_3.title: Beating the Heat - III
quest.guide.temperature.cold_3.descripti: Coat your armor to increase §6heat resistance§r by 7 points.
quest.guide.temperature.hot_1.title: Bracing the Cold - I
quest.guide.temperature.hot_1.descriptio: Coat your armor to increase §bcold resistance§r by 3 points.
quest.guide.temperature.hot_2.title: Bracing the Cold - II
quest.guide.temperature.hot_2.descriptio: Coat your armor to increase §bcold resistance§r by 5 points.
quest.guide.temperature.hot_3.title: Bracing the Cold - III
quest.guide.temperature.hot_3.descriptio: Coat your armor to increase §bcold resistance§r by 7 points.
quest.guide.temperature.adapt_1.title: Adaptive Insulation - I
quest.guide.temperature.adapt_1.descript: Coat your armor to increase §dboth resistances§r by 3 points.
quest.guide.temperature.adapt_2.title: Adaptive Insulation - II
quest.guide.temperature.adapt_2.descript: Coat your armor to increase §dboth resistances§r by 5 points.
quest.guide.temperature.adapt_3.title: Adaptive Insulation - III
quest.guide.temperature.adapt_3.descript: Coat your armor to increase §dboth resistances§r by 7 points.
quest.guide.hordebuilding.subtitle: DONT DEAD OPEN INSIDE
quest.guide.hordebuilding.title: Not your regular building...
quest.guide.hordebuilding.desc_1: Certain §bspecial buildings§r will always contain a §chorde§r of infected.
quest.guide.hordebuilding.desc_1.horde: You have entered a horde building!
quest.guide.hordebuilding.desc_2: Clear the horde by killing the infected.
quest.guide.hordebuilding.desc_2.horde: The horde seems to be lessening...
quest.guide.hordebuilding.desc_3: Once the horde has been dealt with, the building can be explored normally.
quest.guide.hordewave.subtitle: 15 days to Die
quest.guide.hordewave.title: The zombies... they're coming...
quest.guide.hordewave.desc_1: Infected hordes show up every §c15§r days. This counter is tracked §6per player§r, and not tied to overall server time. §cIf you are in multiplayer, this could mean hordes back to back!§r
quest.guide.hordewave.desc_2: Each subsequent horde will be §cstronger§r than the last, so be sure to upgrade your gear and prepare defenses for your base!
quest.guide.hordewave.desc_3: Crafting a §bhorde calendar§r and right clicking it will show you how many days are left until the next horde.
quest.guide.scrapping.title: Recycling Items
quest.guide.scrapping.subtitle: *Anvil Break Noises*
quest.guide.scrapping.subtitle_2: You've got the scraps... now to find a cave.
quest.guide.scrapping.desc_1: Items with the §6"Scrappable"§r tooltip can be recycled at a §bscrapping table§r.
quest.guide.scrapping.desc_2: Scrapped items will return §630%%~70%%§r of the items used to craft them.
quest.guide.scrapping.desc_3: To scrap an item, place a scrappable item on the table with §6[F]§r, then §6left click§r your scrapping hammer while looking at the item.
quest.guide.tutorial.subtitle: Welcome to DeceasedCraft!
quest.guide.tutorial.readme.title: Welcome to DeceasedCraft!
quest.guide.tutorial.readme.subtitle: This is how you died...
quest.guide.tutorial.readme.description_:
If you've just started a new world, you will have §bone day§r of relative safety where no zombies will spawn. 
Use it to familiarize yourself with the guidebook!

§cWARNING:§r While world generation will try to place you in the §bSuburb Residential District§r, §cthe district may still be too small to sucessfully survive in§r.

If that is the case, you may want to consider re-generating a new world.
quest.guide.tutorial.intro.title: The First Days
quest.guide.tutorial.intro.subtitle: After the Apocalypse
quest.guide.tutorial.intro.description_1:
This questline provides a §brough guide§r to help you progress from the beginning of the game to a comfortable midgame.
It will make references to many of the §6Guides§r in the section below —  take some time to check them out!

----------

§7Many thought it would take longer for society to collapse. That they would have months to prepare, or at least a few weeks to find shelter.§r
quest.guide.tutorial.intro.description_2: §7Instead, it happened almost overnight. People turned on the streets, in their homes, in their shelters —  seemingly at random for no reason at all.§r
quest.guide.tutorial.intro.description_3:
§7Those that did not soon found themselves wishing they had.§r

§oPerhaps your fate will be different?§r
quest.guide.tutorial.infection.title: Unavoidable Infection
quest.guide.tutorial.infection.subtitle: One bite is all it takes… well, maybe a couple.
quest.guide.tutorial.infection.descripti: All zombies have a chance to §cinfect§r their victims upon making contact during an attack.
The infection progresses slowly through multiple stages. Letting it take over will result in your character becoming a zombie.
Certain armor types can negate this effect.
quest.guide.tutorial.goldenapple.title: §aLoot§r - Golden Apples
quest.guide.tutorial.goldenapple.subtitl: An apple a day keeps the zombies away.
quest.guide.tutorial.goldenapple.descrip: The only cure for the infection is by eating §bgolden apples§r.
As they cannot be crafted you will have to loot them from §bmedical buildings§r.
In your starting district, this is the §bPolyclinic§r — but beware, it is heavily guarded by the dead.
quest.guide.world.specialization.title: Talents and Specialization
quest.guide.world.specialization.descrip: Pressing §6[F10]§r will open up your skill tree, which can provide useful perks to improve your performance.
Skills can be levelled up by doing their respective actions, or by reading special guide books found as loot.
quest.guide.world.nether.title: The Nether and the End
quest.guide.world.nether.subtitle: Just a figment of your imagination...
quest.guide.world.nether.description_1: The Nether and the End do §cnot§r exist in this modpack. Instead, you will have to loot their resources from the city.
quest.guide.world.compass.title: §9Craft§r - Nature's Compass
quest.guide.world.compass.subtitle: Guide to Nowhere
quest.guide.world.compass.description_1: A §bNature's Compass§r is invaluable for finding biomes such as the §bvolcano§r and §bwasteland§r, as well for locating §bdistricts§r.
quest.guide.world.compass.description_2:
§6Useful biomes to search for:§r

§bSnowy Plains§r = §eRetail District§r
§bConiferous Forest§r = §eHighrise Residential District§r
§bPlain§r = §eHighrise Office District§r
§bRainforest§r = §eHighrise Hotel District§r
quest.guide.world.compass.description_3: §NOTE:§r The compass will always guide you to the closest biome of that type within §65000§r blocks, so travel in the opposite direction if the biome you find doesn't end up suitable for you!
quest.guide.tutorial.districts.title: Suburb Residential - §eTier 1 District§r
quest.guide.tutorial.districts.subtitle: What do you mean people live in these?
quest.guide.tutorial.districts.descripti: This modpack is split into §66§r districts, each with increasing §cdifficulty§r and §ctempreature§r.
You should always spawn in the §bSuburban Residential§r district, which is relatively peaceful.

§cIt is recommended to only explore other districts once you've prepared sufficiently.§r 
The following quests list some recommended items you should try to get in each tier of district before you move on.
For a detailed list of all districts and their buildings, consult the §6District List§r chapter.
quest.guide.world.backpack.title: §9Craft§r - Backpack
quest.guide.world.backpack.subtitle: Everything including the kitchen sink.
quest.guide.world.backpack.description_1: As you scavenge, you are likely to run out of space for items extremely quickly.
quest.guide.world.backpack.description_2: Consider crafting a §bbackpack§r and upgrading it as soon as possible.
quest.guide.world.backpack.description_3: §cNOTE:§r You are limited to only having §bone§r backpack at a time. Carrying more backpacks in your inventory will §cslow you down§r!
quest.guide.tutorial.canteen.title: §9Craft§r|§aLoot§r - Canteen
quest.guide.tutorial.canteen.subtitle: Compact water source
quest.guide.tutorial.canteen.description: §bCanteens§r are useful for storing large amounts of water to drink when you get thirsty.
An added benefit is that water stored in it will be §bautomatically purified§r. However, there are more efficient ways of restoring thirst.
For further information on obtaining and purifying water, do check out the §6Survival§r chapter.
quest.guide.tutorial.healing.title: §9Craft§r | §aLoot§r - Healing Items
quest.guide.tutorial.healing.subtitle: Patch yourself up
quest.guide.tutorial.healing.description: Looted §bstring§r and §bwool§r can be crafted into §bbandages§r, which provide a small amount of healing.
You should aim to have a healthy supply of these, as they are the main way of restoring health.
For further information on the body part health system in this mod, do check out the §6Survival§r chapter.
quest.guide.tutorial.supplies.title: §aLoot§r - Supplies and Weapons
quest.guide.tutorial.supplies.subtitle: Can't fight on an empty stomach
quest.guide.tutorial.supplies.descriptio: Many early game §bweapons§r and §barmor§r can be found by looting the starting district's houses and §bPolice Substation§r.
Likewise, food can also be found by looting §bgas stations§r.
If you have the resources, consider §bpreparing your food§r instead of eating it raw, as cooked meals restore more hunger.
quest.guide.tutorial.insulation.title: Dealing with Tempreature
quest.guide.tutorial.insulation.subtitle: Put on a Coat
quest.guide.tutorial.insulation.descript: §bCold String§r and §bWarm String§r can be used to craft §dCoats§r, which when combined with armor on a §bsewing table§r will allow you to venture further.
quest.guide.tutorial.tier_2_districts.de: Obtaining a full set of §dinsulated§b armor will allow you to safely enter the §eTier 2§r §bHighrise Office§r §7(hot)§r or §bHighrise Residential§r §7(cold)§r districts.
Consider §bupgrading your weapons§b, as infected here will be §rstronger§r than in the starter district.
For a detailed list of all districts and their buildings, consult the §6District List§r chapter.
quest.guide.tutorial.iron.title: §aLoot§r - Iron
quest.guide.tutorial.iron.subtitle: The Iron Age
quest.guide.tutorial.iron.description_1: §eTier 2§r districts contain iron, which can be used to craft the second tier of weapons and armor.
quest.guide.tutorial.iron.description_2: All §eTier 2§r armor sets can be found in the §6Armor Sets§r chapter.
quest.guide.tutorial.iron.description_3: All §eTier 2§r weapons can be found in the §6Melee Weapons§r chapter.
quest.guide.tutorial.guns.title: §9Craft§r | §aLoot§r - Ranged Weapons
quest.guide.tutorial.guns.subtitle: Pew! Pew! Pew!
quest.guide.tutorial.guns.description_1: §eTier 2§r districts are the first place where you can reliably find §bguns§r, their §bcomponents§r and §bammunition§r.
quest.guide.tutorial.guns.description_2: For a list of what components can be found in which district, consult the §6Ranged Weapons§r chapter.
quest.guide.tutorial.storage.title: §6Tech§r | §aLoot§r - Refined Storage
quest.guide.tutorial.storage.subtitle: It's not a hoarding problem, I swear
quest.guide.tutorial.storage.description: §bOffice buildings§r in §eTier 2§r districts contain an abundance of §6Refined Storage§r loot.
This allows you to easily set up a §bRefined Storage system§r, for easier management of all your items.
A basic guide to Refined Storage can be found in the §6Refined Storage§r chapter.
quest.guide.tutorial.power.title: §6Tech§r | §aLoot§r - Power
quest.guide.tutorial.power.subtitle: Keeping the lights on
quest.guide.tutorial.power.description_1: Many components needed to set up both §6Create§r and §6Immersive Engineering§r's power generation can be looted in the city.
quest.guide.tutorial.power.description_2: For now, the simplest power sources would be §bWater Wheels§r for §6Create§r, and §bThermoelectric Generators§r for §6Immersive Engineering§r.
quest.guide.tutorial.power.description_3: A list of all available power generation methods, and how to set them up can be found in the §6Power Generation§r chapter.
quest.guide.tutorial.steel_early.title: §6Tech§r - Early Steel
quest.guide.tutorial.steel_early.descrip: §6Immersive Engineering§r allows for the production of §bsteel§r from §biron§r, a §eTier 3§r material.
If you have an established base, setting up §bsteel production§r will make exploring further much easier.
The steps to produce steel can be found in §6The Basics§r and §6Advanced Materials§r chapter.
quest.guide.tutorial.basic_armor.title: §aLoot§r - Basic Armor Components
quest.guide.tutorial.basic_armor.descrip: §bBasic Armor Components§r are required to make and repair §biron§r gear.
It is recommended you save armor components for repairs, as iron gear can be easily looted in the city.
All §eTier 2§r armor sets can be found in the §6Armor Sets§r chapter.
quest.guide.tutorial.base.title: Settling Down
quest.guide.tutorial.base.subtitle: A place to call Home
quest.guide.tutorial.base.description_1: If you haven't already, consider locating a suitable place to establish a permanent §bbase§r, as further progression will require some §6tech§r involvement.
quest.guide.tutorial.base.description_2: You can find specific buildings to live in using the §bBuilding Radar§r.
quest.guide.tutorial.base.description_3: A guide on how to use it can be found in the §6District List§r chapter.
quest.guide.tutorial.npcs.title: §aLoot§r - NPCs
quest.guide.tutorial.npcs.subtitle: You can take them home
quest.guide.tutorial.npcs.description_1: Finding and completing §bNPC quests§r will allow you to §btrade§r with them, allowing for a renewable source of some important resources.
quest.guide.tutorial.npcs.description_2: You can pick them up and move them around by §6sneak-right clicking them with an empty hand§r.
quest.guide.tutorial.npcs.description_3: A list of all NPCs and which district they can be found is in the §6District List§r chapter.
quest.guide.tutorial.tier_3_districts.de: Rare or better §dCoats§r will allow you to safely enter the §eTier 3§r §bHighrise Hotel§r §7(very hot)§r or §bRetail§r §7(very cold)§r districts.
Consider §bupgrading your weapons and armor§r to at least §biron§r, or §bsteel§r if you have it.
For a detailed list of all districts and their buildings, consult the §6District List§r chapter.
§bIntermediate Armor Components§r are required to make and repair §bsteel§r gear.
Steel gear is quite §crare§r, and it is likely you will need to §bmanually craft§r a set.
All §eTier 3§r armor sets can be found in the §6Armor Sets§r chapter.
quest.guide.tutorial.steel.title: §aLoot§r - Steel
quest.guide.tutorial.steel.subtitle: The Steel Age
quest.guide.tutorial.steel.description_1: If you did not automate it, §bsteel§r can be looted in §eTier 3§r districts.
quest.guide.tutorial.steel.description_3: The steps to produce steel can be found in §6The Basics§r and §6Advanced Materials§r chapter.
quest.guide.tutorial.vehicles.title: §6Tech§r | §9Craft§r - Vehicles
quest.guide.tutorial.vehicles.subtitle: Are we there yet
quest.guide.tutorial.vehicles.descriptio: It is likely some districts will be located §ca considerable distance away§r from your starting location.
Consider making a §bcar§r, §btrain§r or §bplane§r to shorten the travel time!
Chapters on how to make vehicles can be found in the §6Transportation§r tab.
quest.guide.world.animal_pen.title: §9Craft§r - Animal Pens
quest.guide.world.animal_pen.subtitle: How do they all fit in there?
quest.guide.world.animal_pen.description: You can craft §banimal pens§r to compact large herds of animals into a single block.
Not only is this better for performance, it also allows for easier interaction and harvesting.
quest.guide.tutorial.wasteland.title: The Wasteland - §eTier 4 District§r
quest.guide.tutorial.wasteland.subtitle: The Final Frontier
quest.guide.tutorial.wasteland.descripti: §cEND OF CONTENT: The beta does not contain content beyond this point!§r
If you have reached this far, §bcongratulations§r! You should be able to comfortably handle whatever this modpack throws at you.
From now on, §eyou will be on your own§r — bring your best §bgear§r and §bweapons§r, don as much §dheat protection§r as you can, and get ready to face the start of the end.
quest.guide.tutorial.seek_cure.title: Rediscovering the Cure
quest.guide.tutorial.seek_cure.subtitle: A New Chapter Begins
quest.guide.tutorial.seek_cure.descripti: You may have learned to survive, but rebuilding civilization will take more than just skill and perseverance.
To truly escape the infection, you must learn to conquer it, a process which starts by rediscovering the methods used to craft the cure.
